item.title: Bear with me
item.description: Language is a fascinating organism. It might seems rigid, especially after consulting a grammar book or a dictionary, but over millenia it mutates and adapts, both randomly and through the need to describe new objects. Today, we’ll talk bears. Going back Where do they come from? My standard approach is to consult the wiktionary, which tells us the word comes from Proto-Germanic *berô, an ancestor also to beer (Dutch), Bär (German) and bjørn (Danish).
